de.sciss.swingosc
Class WindowResponder

java.lang.Object
  de.sciss.swingosc.AbstractResponder
      de.sciss.swingosc.WindowResponder
All Implemented Interfaces:
ComponentListener, WindowFocusListener, WindowListener, EventListener
public class WindowResponder
extends AbstractResponder
implements ComponentListener, WindowListener, WindowFocusListener

An WindowResponder is created for a frame component. When instantiating, the responder starts to listen to WindowEvents fired from that component, until remove is called. When an event occurs, the responder will send a /window OSC message to the client that has created the responder, with the first argument being the component's ID, followed by the state change, e.g. opened, closing, iconified etc., followed key-value pairs of properties. The property key names are specified in he constructor.

Version:
0.53, 02-Jul-07
Author:
Hanns Holger Rutz
